Support for in memory prefetching of element subset for increased query and loading time performance. Per-field representation or persisted model in separate generic resources in order ensure model serialization remains scalable

Added element metadata support. Metadata contain either extra information on existing items or information on items not present in the infrastructure anymore, such as inactive DataSources. Metadata contain implementation agnostic properties, which can be read by whichever repository provider is operating at the given moment. Currently the only element metadata used concerns inactive DataSources. A grace period is defined for inactive DataSources, and after it has elapsed, all searchables and presentables referencing such DataSources are purged from the corresponding fields. This functionality is performed by the updater in an extra outgoing alignment step.

GCube repository provider optionally reads configuration such as inactive DataSource grace period and generic resource name and secondary type. In the absence of such configuration, the default values are used.

Added support for automatic field-searchable-presentable creation. The aforementioned entities will be created by an updater which has the feature enabled. The feature can be enabled by the corresponding property in the gCube repository provider configuration file.

Changed scope handling in order to solve #1705. In the context of a running container, the gHN scopes are being used except root infrastructure scopes. In client mode, the previous behavior is retained, whereby the working scopes of the provider are the start scopes of the container, plus all VRE scopes under the latter.
